alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 7:16PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chase and southeastern Marion Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 716 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burns, or 6 miles south of Florence, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Florence, Burns, Elmdale, Cedar Point, Hymer, Wonsevu, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and east central Kansas.
